article_title: Alaska Attorney General's office fights House-led appeal in Medicaid lawsuit
article_text: On May 5, the Legislature's outside attorneys filed the appeal in Supreme Court, naming the Legislative Council as the plaintiff. However, the council never voted to continue the case, and under an opinion by the Legislature's lawyer, it had no authority to take a vote even if it wanted to. The legal opinion said the Legislative Council's authority to sue expired when the full Legislature went into session, and the Senate and House would have to vote on continuing the case.

article_metadata.description: The Alaska Attorney General’s office says the Alaska House lacks the authority to substitute itself for a legislative committee in the appeal of a lower court’s decision to allow Gov. Bill Walker’s Medicaid expansion because lawmakers failed to vote on continuing the case. The legal filing Monday by the Alaska Department of Law comes less … Continue reading Alaska Attorney General’s office fights House-led appeal in Medicaid lawsuit

og.title: Alaska Attorney General's office fights House-led appeal in Medicaid lawsuit

article_summary:
On May 5, the Legislature's outside attorneys filed the appeal in Supreme Court, naming the Legislative Council as the plaintiff.
However, the council never voted to continue the case, and under an opinion by the Legislature's lawyer, it had no authority to take a vote even if it wanted to.
The legal opinion said the Legislative Council's authority to sue expired when the full Legislature went into session, and the Senate and House would have to vote on continuing the case.
